Answer: The problem is that you are creating a new PrintWriter object in each iteration of your loop. This means that you are opening and closing the file in each iteration, which is why you are only seeing one line of output. To solve this, you should create the PrintWriter object outside of the loop and close it after the loop. Here is the corrected code:

```java
PrintWriter out = null;
frameworkcucc fw = new frameworkcucc();
try {
    out = new PrintWriter("valtozok.txt");
    for (int i = 1; i < 100; i++) {
        Random rand = new Random();
        System.out.println(i);
        int kiirando = rand.nextInt();
        fw.writetotext(kiirando, out);
    }
} catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
} finally {
    if (out != null) {
        out.close();
    }
}
```

In this corrected code, the PrintWriter object `out` is created before the loop and is closed in the `finally` block, ensuring that the file is closed after all the data has been written.
